attributes.action: Update laws & policies to allow the exclusion of males from female-only spaces
attributes.additional_details: Survivors of sexual assault rely on shelters and support groups as safe havens where they can find solace among those with similar experiences, and rebuild their futures. Broadening access to males will discourage survivors from seeking assistance or inflict further emotional distress.
attributes.background: Update current laws and policies to allow the exclusion of males, despite how they identify, from female-only spaces, such as women's domestic violence shelters and female prisons. Maintaining these spaces will help keep women safe from rape and violence.

rejection.details:
The Equality Act 2010 already allows for provision of single-sex services, including single-sex services that exclude trans persons, where this is a proportionate means of achieving a legitimate aim.

You can find out more about the Equality Act and single-sex services here: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/advice-and-guidance/separate-and-single-sex-service-providers-guide-equality-act-sex-and-gender
